data.title: Autographs you treasure most
data.meta_description: I'm hoping to get a Mr. Hoffman, our leader
data.text:
I have a few autographs although I don't really collect them. these are my only ones.

Several that Herb Alpert signed for our family on publicity 8x10 photos. (my grandmother used to work for him)

Hillary Hahn the violinest on a sacd during an intermission at a concert

Robert Fripp on a cd. I was at a concert in a club and standing next to this guy before the show then I noticed he had this stack of cds and was writing something on the booklets I looked a little closer and it said Robert Fripp then I looked at the guy a little closer and it was Robert Fripp, so I bought one.

Not a real collector, but I have a few:

Born to Run LP signed by Springsteen and the band

The River LP signed by Springsteen and the band

Born in the USA program signed by the band (no Springsteen)

Born in the USA T shirt signed by the band (no Springsteen)

backstage passes for 2 Houston shows from The River tour signed by Springsteen

Russians and Americans LP signed by Al Stewart and the band

Russians and Americans T shirt signed by Al Stewart and the band

Chicago 17 signed by entire band

A stack of Townes Van Zandt LPs and CDs signed by Townes

Kris Kristofferson LP signed by Kris

Broken English LP signed by Marianne Faithful

Dangerous Aquaintances LP signed by Marianne Faithful

Yes tour program circa the Tales era signed by the band. I don't remember getting these signatures, but I do remember Wakeman sitting and playing the piano alone in a deserted hotel bar.

A stack of Rodney Crowell CDs signed by Rodney Crowell

A stack of Rosanne Cash CDs signed by Rosanne Cash

Badfinger and *** LPs signed by Mike, Tom, and Joey

Bunch of LPs signed by Mickey Newbury

One that got away: Ian Anderson circa War Child. I was (supposedly) on an elevator and he stepped in, and I talked to him for about 10 minutes after the ride. (I don't remember this, either, but the girl who was with me swears it happened, and says she remembers it so clearly because of the way I started taking to Anderson like him suddenly getting on the elevator with us was the most normal thing in the world, while she was so freaked that it happened she never said a word the whole time.)

It was my 50th birthday in April this year. In July I got Jay's autograph on the first Son Volt CD, backstage at Calgary Folk Music Festival.

_____________________________

Where do I start.

Politicians

Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and then wife Margaret Trudeau on the program sheet at a private Liberal Party fund raising dinner in Winnipeg, MB, 1972.

Novels

several SF authors including William Gibson, Spider Robinson, Joe Haldeman, and Charles de Lint.

Festival staff pass

Kris Kristofferson (2006, Calgary Folk Music Festival)

Tour books.

Harry Chapin from around 1976, 77.

Keith Emerson, Greg Lake, Carl Palmer, from the early 1990s. Backstage at the same concert I was in a group photo with the band. They also autographed my younger brother's Atlantic Years CD booklet.

Vinyl

Split Enz - all albums from Beginning Of The Enz to Time And Tide, Tim Finn, Neil Finn in 1980 and some of the same LPs by Noel Crombie in 1982

Men At Work - Business As Usual all members

several David Bowie, autographed by Carlos Alomar, Serious Moonlight Tour, 1983

several Tubes LPs - Fee Waybill (summer 1983)

The Roches - rare Warner 45 EP "The Hammond Song" - (all three sisters 2006)

The Fixx - several albums - all members

Victoria Williams - Christmas 45

Captain Beyond - Captain Beyond 3D cover and Sufficiently Breathless Lee Dorman and Larry "Rhino" Rheinhardt

CDs (too many to list)

Mermaid Avenue - signed by all original Wilco members and then a year later by Billy Bragg

several Billy Bragg CDs including the rare Polygram Canada only live mini CD

Midnight Oil - Place Without A Postcard (original Australia CBS CD) and the very rare Green Album promo only compilation CD signed by Peter Garrett and one other band member. When Peter was autographing the CDs he said to me that the Green Album was a great compilation and he had yet to own one. He also mentioned that Place Without A Postcard was his most favourite album. (mine too)

Kathleen Edwards, both albums

The Whitlams - Tim Freedman autographed the Warner Canada CD version of Eternal Nightcap and the Australian CD Love This City.

Nick Lowe - Labour Of Lust (original U.K. Demon CD) While Nick was signng the CD, next to us Warren Zevon was autographing a rare CD for a friend of mine.

Robyn Hitchcock - Greatest Hits A&M and Eye (original Twin Tone CD)

Chumbawamba - English Rebel Songs 1381 - 1984

Thea Gilmore - all of her CDs (also autographed by her producer, lead guitarist, boyfriend Nigel Stonier)

several Giant Sand CDs and LPs by Howe Gelb, John Coventino and Joey Burns. My all-time fave autograph is from Howe on the Centre Of The Universe CD. He wrote, "Steve Earle steals our $h*t". COTU was release in 1992. Steve Earle - El Corazón came out in 1997.

GiantSand-COTU-sml.jpg

File size:

104.1 KB

Views:

File size:

113.4 KB

Views:

Artists have signed stuff I've handed them, stars have signed pictures, creative people have signed books I bring them, telling them what chapters I enjoyed most. But...

I treasure the signature of a little-known jazzy artist of the 80's named Robert Kraft. He was a buddy of Bruce Willis back in the salad days, and had a jazz combo with his brother called The Ivory Coast. Later he got a producing gig with Disney, and did a few of their animated soundtrack albums. I especially love his album, Moodswing.

It matters to me, because I discovered his music from a pile of un-heard radio promo albums, and later wrote him a letter. He wrote me a nice one back, and signed it. He wasn't one of the "majors", but he took the time to write a thank-you while his career was in transition.

I have never forgotten, "It takes a keen eye to know what's a dead end, and what's a false start."

I've got on e of those as well. There were only 1,000 of 'em, I believe. Had to buy about 10 copies 'til I got one -- via mail order, if I remember correctly.

These are all great stories! I'm extremely jealous of everyone who has any Beatles autographs, particularly John's...

I have the regular Beatles-fans circuit autographs, like Pete Best, Mark Hudson, Joey Molland, Billy Preston (RIP). I must say I really cherish my Barry Tashian autographs and photos with him--he's one of my favorites, and he was so incredibly nice. Lloyd Green, the legendary steel guitarist, signed my copy of Sweethearts of the Rodeo when I met him in Nashville.

I really love my Ian "Mac" MacLagan autograph, too.

I have a humorous autograph story...Kelley Deal (twin sister of Kim of the Pixies, member of The Breeders with her sister) was playing a gig at a very small club in Knoxville called The Mercury Theatre (RIP) about 11 years ago. I brought my Breeders' Last Splash cd for her to sign if possible. As she walked by, I politely stopped her and asked if she would please sign my cd, to which she replied, "You know I'm not Kim, right?" I assured her that I knew who she was. She signed the inside cover, and since she had lost a lot of weight since the photo was taken, she proceeded to color in a smaller waist line for herself! (I was saddened to hear that she was arrested for heroin possession very shortly after that gig! I think she's doing well now.)

I JUST saw Stewkey with his New Nazz group last week! They were quite good and it was great to hear him belting out those classic Nazz tunes. He's still got it - totally nailed "Hello It's Me" and "Under the Ice"! Check him out if he comes around near you! I could have gotten his autograph, but I just wanted to enjoy the show...............I'll probably regret not trying - oh well!

I also forgot another autograph that I like though I didn't get it in person:

Years ago I picked up a used LP of the 1978 album "Live Grape" from the sort-of reformed Moby Grape. It was only $2, not in great shape, but okay. Played it, filed it and that was that. Maybe a year later I pull it out to spin again and I notice writing on the cover (the cover is a dark maroon - the writing was in blue, ball-point pen ink and not at all obvious at first......). What does it say? (In very neat script I should mention........) "To my good friend Jimmy. Rock on, bro! SKIP SPENCE"!

That one still amazes me - for all that's been written about his problems, the guy had beautiful handwriting! Too cool.

------- Chris

In response to a couple of private requests, I am posting a picture of Brazilian volleyball stars (of the 1990s) Ana Paula (left) and Fernanda. They are both about 6'1" and very fit. And when I met them, they turned out to be very well-mannered and gracious young ladies.
